WRITING.TITLE: Drinking in a bona fide sex motel alone cheers !

WRITING.TEXT: Will it really bother you to see her? If so maybe it's not the best idea. Alcohol is great, but afterwards or during it might really upset you to see her if she's with someone or etc. Partying is great, I've heard, but it sounds like unless you too get along it's not the best idea. Sorry to be so... sober about it lol.
No lol but some woman at the front, in full on makeup like Milan level shit, asked for 3 hours then left. And I hear people barfing. Yikes !

Go home. Trust me. I'm an idiot and done a lot of really stupid things. That situation has no good ending other than you not going, or leaving asap. I know I sound like a mom, but I've been in similar stuff and there is no happy ending especially on a party night. I wish you the best, but get home safely if you are out there, because the wandering drunk mind rarely wanders anywhere good. I'm on all night to talk if you need. *typo on drunk
I'm not sober, I just drank way too much for too long and saw a lot happen so I figured put in my two cents, maybe help someone out in a tiny way.
Cheers homeslice, it may be a choice for some, but being alone is never a reason to not have a stiff one.

The sun will rise, make sure you drink long enough to see it ! Drunk sunrise is a pleasure I have seldom gotten. But seriously sorry about that. I'll raise my shitty sex motel cup to you in camaraderie !

I think that might be a calm before the storm, a way of not recognizing the major impact or effect it will have. I Have been there, I attempted last year, and before that I had been suicidal for over 20 years. I'm only 26 now, and honestly I believe that calmness and serenity is part of rationalizing and minimising the major impact your death will have. Please call someone or see a therapist. I have been there, and it's a terribly seductive allure of "peace" but it isn't, it's everything but.

For them, maybe. For me, eh. I haven't had a drink in 10 months and im in a sex motel. But I am getting drunk as we speak. Would be better to have a partner to just enjoy it with, but hey. Ill take what I can get.

I get that completely. I've been the idiot bad ideas, but not like BAD , just dumb. I try to be the voice of reason but I haven't drank for 10 months so my tolerance is shit and, nobody to share it with lol. But i like this sub a lot.

Send me a message ill chat as much as you want. I'm a little older, but I have been in similar situations. It's great to talk to someone dude, especially who understands that mindset and can relate. Clearly you and her are going through different things, and people do all kinds of shit and don't acknowledge when it hurts someone else all the time. But im sorry this is hurting you Mr. Bacon.

So I bought a room for the night, in N.Y. area that's a hundred bucks. But they a posted 3 hour special deal, and people asking for it. Im here because I dont want to be home, right now, and I was supposed to be with a friend until Monday but they made ne drive all the back from 5 hours away and then left without a goodbye. I'm not into the activities that clearly go on here, I'm just taking in the "splendor" of the night.

thank you. I tried to not only keep myself out of it, but create a realistic as possible drawing of myself while highlighting both the bottle, cup, cigarettes, and picture of cheers. Genuinely im not an art 101 guru or taker, I just didn't want to show my face or anything but wanted to show myself in a way. Seriously i appreciate the comment. * edit on word ( from boothe to both)
Ah , I would answer that in a private message lol. And yes dumb is way different than crazy. Like dumb = calling exes, Crazy = driving as fast as one can while drunk.

It actually is surprisingly. Where I was before was, for the price, way Better than to be expected. This place has mirrors in areas I've never considered. It is clean and heating works lol. So, what are you doing on r / drunk?
Haha will do , and exactly lolol #128514;
What I do is, Tylenol, water or Powerade. Eggs, Adderall ( only if prescribed) , caffeine, and boom. You will feel odd like light. But it will work.

It's what it is. Great at times, a reminder of our communal problem ay others. Or a mix of both. It serves a great purpose and makes people think. I love this sub honestly. Because it's real, and that's something
I'm really sorry to hear this. I hope you are okay this day.

Good choice for your point. I had never heard of this but it does perfectly exemplify a blameless apology bullshit response. Personally I think she is way over rated in terms of acting and everything else, plus her best performance was in winters bone not silver linings playlist imho. But Hey, I'm not a member of the academy lol.
Maybe you could seek help, or talk to a friend. That seems to help me sometimes. I recently have lost a lot of days, sometimes it feels like every day too. I'm here to talk if you need.
You wrote this, you aren't losing. Every day you get up and even just logging on shows that you try.

I feel the same, and I've come to the small realization that sometimes we are all we have and that relying on those we know won't be there is just perpetuating a detrimental cuddle of disappointment and depression. I'm not saying I'm enlightened, im majorly depressed and have been for my entire life. I'm here to talk, it's good to have company to talk about this to even if it's just a random person on the internet. I care about everyone, while that doesn't sound personal, it is. I'm here.

This is awesome news. George Lucas, for all whatever people say about him regarding the prequels, is a visionary who clearly cares a lot about film and the projects he helped create and that came long before and after his break into movies. A museum for narrative media sounds incredible, and im sure it will be a delight. American graffiti is a classic film, as are the original 3 films, and if I make over to California once this is done I will happily take a trip to that Museum.
Too accurate. Upvoted.

Recently diagnosed, explains a lot more than just major depressive and adhd with anxiety. I'm glad to have the diagnosis and to start moving forward with steps to combat the symptoms when I can and keep my life in check. Good luck to all those struggling with or without borderline, we are all in the sane mental health fight. Every day we are here, we are winning.
I agree. Thank you for sharing, I hope it works out for you, I'm sure it will

It is an accurate post for sure. I saw the futuristic setting for BO4 and I can say im severely disappointed. I figured going back to like Persian gulf war era or earlier would have been a solid move, given the firearm familiarity and variability as well as a continued botg style. The gameplay reveal only reiterated the problems I saw from bo3 and people's panning of iw. I enjoyed Iw, but wwii's botg felt good again. My favorite cod title was mw followed by black ops 1, and I think many were severely let down by the reveal. The additional worrying information of apparently no single player, which was awesome in both BO1 and mw 1-3 is extremely disappointing and odd. I was not the biggest fan of wwii at launch, but it has improved. I enjoy the new weapons and the zombies mode coming out. I think shg did a necessary reshuffling of key personnel and it's been better. I also will say at present I don't plan on buying bo4 as is. Sorry for long post, but that's just how I feel and maybe some feel the same.

There are specific challenges for each character and for each map a different set of characters can be unlocked. I would do a quick Google search because a lot of the details I don't know, but they are difficult to get in all honesty. I have on and that is from the darkest shore. I'm sorry I can't be more help but it is a grind to get any of them. I wanted to get more, but getting to round 20 without leaving a single room is a bit out of my skill range.

It is less grand than bb, but great in its own right as a different type of slow burn show. Seriously if you enjoyed bb you will very much enjoy how much it picks up after season 1.

I don't have schizophrenia, but I do have borderline personality disorder, major depression and ADHD. I have been hospitalized twice and met many people with schizophrenia and related disorders like schizoaffective disorder. Most recently I met a man who preemptively hospitalized himself because he was having paranoid delusions about people wanting to harm him, people did not want to and he knew this but his condition told him otherwise. He received care and treatment for his disorder and they stabilized the delusions and he left more stable after a stay in the hospital. I don't think it is selfish of you at all to hospitalize yourself because you feel something bad may happen if you don't. That is being very intelligent and reasonable regarding the treatment for your condition and cognizant of what you need. It isn't selfish to take care of yourself. There will be beds for those who need them and you need to prioritize your recovery. I was hospitalized for two suicide attempts and I know that if I felt that way again to the point where I would consider hospitalization I would put myself in to protect myself. I think you sound like a caring and rational person and my advice would be to go in if you feel yourself sliding to a place that is awful and dangerous. Sorry for the long post but I wish you the best in this tough time.

I hope for those that are part of those toxic communities can eventually get help too. They are people. Just like all of us.

I have felt that way too. I cover my arms at all times with long sleeve shirts and jeans at all times, even in the summer. I always feel some camaraderie with people who have scars, but I know the feeling of being unable to say something because of company. I'm sorry you weren't able to talk to that person, but this seems to be a supportive subreddit and your post is nice to see for me because it reminds me that I'm not alone and someone may see me and that they too feel similarly. Thank you.
